intro: Swida alternifolia, commonly known as the alternateleaf swida, is a shrub native to the temperate regions of East Asia. It is characterized by its alternate arrangement of leaves, which are typically ovate to elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Swida alternifolia thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
